info.name: SYSTEM API
info.description:
# SYSTEM API --- This Postman collection will used during the developmment process for this API REST.

The API REST described here will use the backend service developed for the website systemagency.com

Right now the postman collection have 4 primary routes that allow a simple data flow during the usage from this API: - Talent. - Work. - Resource. - Component.
Each *primary route* have a set of routes and examples associeated with each one. Trying to increase the expression of the routes and the usability ofthe API for every client who want to use it. ## Hint This description will serve a documentation only from the API described during all this Postman Collection.

For a deployment process there not exist much information, for more details, please follow the next github repository (allowed only for collaborators). - https://github.com/realFranco/SA_rest_api

item.name: Agency_User

formdata.description: Do not need it the "@domain.com"
Enable this to get an error

request.description:
Endpoint to insert a row into the Agency_User table.

Only two arguments are available for this request. If the body have not this two arguments: - system_[email | password]

An error will be thown.

query.description: Comma Separated Value
Comma Separated Value

request.description:
This endpoint will let the client to filter rows from the table Agency_User.

The body can include or exlcude attributes from the row selected, follow the example body.

If the body do not contain the next arguments: - system_user_id - system_email

The the endpoint will scan the table Agency_User.

query.description: Comma Sepparated Value
Comma Sepparated Value
Comma Separated Value
Comma Separated Value

formdata.description: uuid from the user
Can pass "name" or "name@domain.com"

request.description:
Update and Users' **password** attribute.

The body can obtain two arguments to select the correct row and edit the password attribute: - system_user_id - system_email

If the body detect those arguments, by precedence *system_email* will be use it, instead of *system_user_id*.

Watch the body example.

formdata.description: Can pass "name" or "name@domain.com"
uuid from the user
uuid from the user
Enable this to wath errors

request.description:
Route to delete one or many row(s) from the table Agency_User.

If the body it is empty then, all the elements from the table will be deleted.

In other hand, delete a row by email or by the identifier: - system_user_id - system_email

If the body contain that two arguemnts, by precedence the *system_user_id* will be take it first, instead of *system_email*.

formdata.description: Enable this to wath errors

item.description:
## Agency_User
---
This collection will manage the set of rows from the table **Agency_User**,
and grant access into some private routes, for more information about 
this table, follow the UML - ERD image from the folder "/utils".

item.name: Auth

request.description:
This endpint will create a token.

The body need the next arguments for a correct token request: - system_email - system_password

item.description:
## Authentitication

The next set of endpoints, will manage the tokens need it to add a tiny "security layer" over some private endpoints.

Endpoint to delete components.

That is the precedence order of selection for the attribute to lead a delete query.

request.description:
Endpoint to delete resources.

Delete by [**id_rsc** | **id_talent** | **id_work**]. Keep the body empty for delete all reosurces.

That is the precedence order of selection for an attribute to lead a delete query.

For example: - If the client write "id_work" and "id_rsc" as arguments for a request delete, will be selected "id_rsc" instead of "id_work".

This endpoint will let you fetch Talents by section.

This filter will retrieve a tiny set of elements for every Talent, and only the necessary ones for the talent preview:
- name - last_name - slug - cover image

women | men

formdata.description: Talent identifier.
Slug of the Talent.

request.description:
The upgrades of the argumentes coming from the body.

The client can pass *id_talent* or *slug* as arguments to find the correct row for update. If both are passed as arguments for the query update will be catch first *id_talent*.

The rest of the body will contain arguments/attrs. to update.

formdata.description: Talent identifier.
Slug of the Talent.

request.description:
Endpoint to delete talents.

Delete by [**id_talent** | **slug**]. Keep the body empty for delete all works.

That is the precedence order of selection for an attribute to lead a delete query.

For example: - If the client write "slug" and "id_talent" as arguments for a request delete, will be selected "id_talent" instead of "slug".

item.description:
## Talent
---
This collection will be usefull for manage the rows from the table **Talent**
 (read the UML - ERD at the "/utils" folder from this repository).

### Hint

This backend will have a set of triggers that manage the **slug** 
attributes allowed from this table. Follow the file  name */db/2_trigger...*
for more information about the functions and the trigger that affect 
this table.

item.name: Work

formdata.description: Talent Name that appear in the work. [Required]
Description of the Work row. [Required]

formdata.value: Aivita Muze features in Dior Magazine's celebration of Spring, photographed by Liz Collins.

formdata.description: Available on Landing Page only
Position of the work, related with the render order.
Available on Work Page only
component destiny of the cover, CSV format
component destiny of the photoset, CSV format

request.description:
Endpoint for Create a work.

This endpoint will let the client to **create only one work on each request**. More than one element uploaded at the body will result into a syntax error.

Watch the **ERD** to follow the complete list of arguments avaliable or need it, to create a new row at the Work table.

Set of components to store the resources: - carousel_main - carousel_work - timeline_main - timeline_work - video_main - work_cover - work_photoset

response.name: Create Work - Error #1

formdata.description: Elements to update as a new work.
Enable this attr. to watch the resulting error.
Title of the Work to insert.

formdata.value: Work listed on carousel main | work.
formdata.description: Description of the Work row.
[Optional] If a talent appear in this Work, then add the id and reference to it.
The rsc. from this Work will be associeted with this component name. CSV

response.name: Create Work

formdata.description: Talent Name that appear in the work
Description of the Work row.
Available on Landing Page only
Position of the work, related with the render order.
The cover can be one IMG or VID
Available on Work Page only
component destiny of the cover CSV format
componet destiny of the photoset CSV format

{
    "result": "ok",
    "http_code": 200,
    "code": 2,
    "message": "Work inserted with slug: a-b-2",
    "items": [
        {
            "created": true,
            "component_name": [
                "work_cover",
                "timeline_work"
            ],
            "type": "image/jpeg",

Change the name of the Talent, will change the slug.

formdata.description: Attr. from work. Check the ERD.
Identifier the elemtno to update.
Identifier the element to update.
You can also update the title. Make sure that the new title will be also unique.
The id_talent need to exist, if not an error will be throw.

formdata.value: This work, now reference a Talent.
formdata.description: Attr. from work. Check the ERD.
Delete by the owner of the work. Deleting only resources created using a work entity.

request.description:
Endpoint to delete works.

Delete by [**id_work** | **slug** | **title** | **id_talent**]. Keep the body empty for delete all works.

That is the precedence order of selection the primary key.

For example: - If the client write "id_work" and "title" as arguments for a request delete, will be selected "id_work" instead of "title".

response.name: Delete Work - id_talent do not exist, del. 0 rows.

formdata.description: Delete by the owner of the work. Deleting only resources created using a work entity.

item.description:
## Work
---
This collection will manage the rows from the table **Work** 
(follow the "/utils" folder to watch the UML - ERD from this table).

### Hint

This Datbase Configuration have a set of functions and a trigger that manage
the **slug** attributes from this table. Follow the file */db/3_trigger...* 
from more information.
